definition: to walk around/to move about/to stretch one's legs/to go for a walk/to be mobile (e.g. after an illness)/to visit one another/to pay a visit (go to the toilet)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: If you are in bed or sitting down, stay there.
sentences.chinese: 如果您是在牀上或坐着，不要走動。

sentences.english: With a car people can go any place without spending a lot of money.
sentences.chinese: 擁有一輛汽車，人們不用花很多錢便可以到處走動。
樓上有人在砰砰地走動。

sentences.english: Her shoes clicked against the floor as she walked.
sentences.chinese: 她走動時，鞋在地板上咔噔咔噔作響。

sentences.english: With these, and a pair of crutches for back-up, a user can walk around.
sentences.chinese: 有了這些和一對柺杖幫忙，使用者可以走動。

sentences.english: It slides up and down my heel when I walk around.
sentences.chinese: 當我走動時，它就在我腳跟上下滑動。

sentences.english: Cautiously, I walked around to the director’s side of the car.
sentences.chinese: 我小心翼翼地繞着理事長的車邊走動。

sentences.english: Though I was yet a mere child my father did not place any restriction on my wanderings.
sentences.chinese: 那時我還是個孩子，父親對我的走動，從不橫加阻攔。

sentences.english: Who are those people milling aroud in the lobby?
sentences.chinese: 在大廳裏來回走動的人是誰？

sentences.english: A parvenu swaggers by oneself at a party.
sentences.chinese: 有個暴發戶在舞會上神氣活現地四處走動。

sentences.english: The cat moved on silent feet.
The pistons go up and down as a person stands on lever devices- treadles- and uses a natural walking motion.
sentences.chinese: 人站在槓桿設置踏板上來回走動，活塞就會上下移動。

sentences.english: You can walk around here without any problem.
sentences.chinese: 你在這裏走動自然不會有問題。

sentences.english: Sometimes I walk around the building.
sentences.chinese: 有時，我在大樓周圍走動。

sentences.english: It is hard to move without seeing the name Vedanta.
sentences.chinese: 四處走動時，很難找到看不見萬達塔這個名字的地方。

sentences.english: He shuffled his feet on the hard wooden floor…
sentences.chinese: 他拖着腳在硬木地板上走動。

definition: to live alone/to spend time alone (or with a significant other)
all over the place/everywhere and all directions
as one wishes/according to one's wishes/at will/voluntary/conscious
to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
from time to time/now and then/occasionally/frequently
to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
